content.original: In 2680, the Star League requested designers to develop 'Mechs which could fly as well as function as standard 'Mechs. The first Land-Air 'Mech off the drawing board, the Shadow Hawk LAM, proved so fatally flawed, the concept was almost shelved. However, LexaTech Industries reworked the conversion equipment and unveiled the first viable LAM, the Stinger LAM in 2688, based on the old Stinger design. LexaTech's reworking of the concept proved so successful, the Land-Air 'Mech became highly sought after, especially for space combat operations. In fact, the Stinger LAM first saw combat destroying a nuclear weapons facility in the Oort Cloud orbiting Sol, Terra's star. The standard production model uses three Magna Medium Lasers mounted on the head and arms. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: Arm Actuator Limit: LeftArm hand RightArm lower This Jihad-era variant appears to be a test-bed used by the Word of Blake. Its performance is identical to the WSP-100 and it retains the bomb bay, but it is built on a Composite Internal Structure. It's also equipped with double heat sinks and a Medium Variable Speed Pulse Laser. The one shot missile launcher has been removed.

content.original:
The Annihilator is an extremely rare 'Mech that is essentially a mobile siege tower. It can kick out more damage than almost any other unit on the field. It's unbelievably slow, though, and poorly armored for its size. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Archer's 2S variant trades some of its long-range punch to become even deadlier when it gets up close, mounting SRMs to follow up what its LRMs have battered. Its heat management still poses a huge problem, though, so its pilots have to stay very wary of overheating. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The well-known Archer is the epitome of the "missile boat" concept. It is commonly found hurling deadly swarms of LRMs at targets from behind the safety of a hill. It's not too shabby in closer-range fights, either. Its only real weakness is terrible heat management. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
The RFL-3N Rifleman is as well known for its terrible armor as for its ability to hammer opponents from long range. It has only average speed and poor heat sinking ability, but if you can put it in the right position, it can rain death on anything it surveys. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Soarece was an experimental superheavy combat vehicle produced for the Free Worlds League in the early decades of the Third Succession War. The design was commissioned by then-Captain-General Philippa Marik in 2881. It was envisioned as a low-cost, highly survivable design that could engage BattleMechs and equip the League's depleted defensive formations . It would be over two decades (2904) until the final form of this design was settled, by which time it had become a mammoth of a tank. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Limited Amphibious Values A S Front 770 126 Left 660 126 Right 660 126 Rear 350 126 Turret 760 126 Total 3200 630 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics

content.original: Debuted in 3144 on the Tennessee Valley Arena and piloted by Marie Costa, the most striking piece of technology this machine features is a Void Signature System followed by the Clan-spec Ferro-Fibrous Armor that replaced its original Capellan-style Starshield Stealth Armor and its eleven Double Heat Sinks. In the weapons section, a single MML-9 launcher appears where once there were twin MML-3s, while the mech losses the Light PPCs in favor of more ER Medium Lasers (now three). Missing is Beagle active probe while an Improved Narc Missile Beacon Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

content.original: This variant is apparently an attempt by the Jade Falcons to use experimental technology in a combat unit. Originally mistaken for a LAM, the Cougar-XR uses a Partial Wing to extend its jump range to 210 meters. An LRM-15 launcher equipped with Artemis V FCS is located in each side torso, while an ER Medium Pulse Laser provides direct fire. It appears that the Cougar-XR is a standard BattleMech instead of being an OmniMech like its progenitor design. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: A uniquely hybridized brawler built from the husk of a CRB-20. Bogdan ''The Steel Beast'' Tubbs had the Big Steel Claw's chassis rebuilt to support the mounting of ballistic weaponry, presumably in the interest of creating a louder and more violent spectacle in the arena. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

content.original: Check it out, Boss we've landed ourselves a FrankenMech! Looks like a Crab, but on the inside, it's at least a quarter Urbie... that's where the new ballistic mounting hardware came from. I'm honestly amazed that this thing even works, but it does, and it's ours now!

content.original: The Gundam is a testament to cutting-edge technology and raw power. With advanced weapons and mobility systems, this machine is built for domination on the battlefield. Its heavily armored exterior provides unrivaled protection from enemy attacks, making it a formidable opponent for any force that stands in its way. The Gundam is a technological marvel, and the pilots who use it should be ready for a high-powered and efficient machine. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Gundam is a technological marvel. Its advanced weapons and mobility systems make it a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. Its heavily armored exterior offers unparalleled protection from enemy attacks. I'm impressed with its capabilities and I have no doubt it will perform well in combat. Anyone using it should be prepared for a high-powered, efficient machine.

content.original: The “Cinderella” is a high speed flashbulb. Fast and nimble, this Gunsmith variant—developed for Team Godmother with a little help from FedSuns benefactors—features Clan-spec weapons and a laser antimissile system to maximize its reach, hitting power, and accuracy all at once Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
This ComStar developed variant is equipped with a pair of Artemis IV-equipped MML-7 launchers with four tons of ammo. It keeps the Gauss Rifle of the standard Highlander and mounts a pair of ER Medium Lasers. CASE II systems protect the Gauss Rifle and missile ammunition from explosions. A C3 Slave unit allows the Highlander to share targeting data. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

The 'Mech is a hulking brute that moves fairly slow yet hits hard. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
This custom Solaris variant debuted in 3128 in Noisiel and piloted first by Natalia Porter and then by her daughter Carolyn Fischer, this Clint IIC upgrade reverses the trend of Clan-modified-Inner-Sphere machines. Starting from the Clan-built frame, the variant drops the Jump Jets to change the weapon load. It keeps the two Clan Extended Range Medium Laser and swaps the Clan LB 10-X AC for a Large Variable Speed Pulse Laser and a Medium Re-Engineered Laser mating them all to a Clan Targeting Computer. The standard plate armor is replaced with Ballistic-Reinforced Armor. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
In 2775 as Aleksander Kerensky's forces were tightening the noose around the Amaris Empire, weapons development became increasingly frantic in hopes of finding a miracle weapon to turn the tides of the war. The most well known of these is the Matar, commonly referred to as Amaris' Folly, an attempt to create a BattleMech able to withstand an entire company. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Originally built as a new assault class mech by Jade Falcon just three years after Project Eryie the Phoenix Hawk IIC LAM is based on the venerable 50 ton Phoenix Hawk LAM but almost twice as heavy at 90 tons. The Phoenix Hawk IIC LAM features as close as possible speed and agility to the original Phoenix Hawk LAM making it an effective fast interdiction unit. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original: Debuted in 3141 on the Tennessee Valley Arena and piloted by Ira Kuhn-Bedard, the variant keeps the best features of this hundred-year-old machine and make it even better. With Clan Ferro-Lamellor Armor improving its resistance to nearly all forms of damage and combined with a Clan-spec XL Engine model instead of the original Inner Sphere one to improve endurance. MASC boosting its land speed, and four Clan ER Medium Lasers replacing all the original weaponry. A Hatchet has been fitted to make it more Solaris Games enabled. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: Developed under the guidance of Angelique Claw for Zellbrigen Stables, the Wraith Alexander combines Experimental Technology from the Clans and Inner Sphere to create a unique 'Mech. The use of a Clan-made XL Engine keeps the speed high, and allows for the installation of more equipment. The jump jets, Endo Steel structure, and Snub-Nose PPC are of Inner Sphere manufacture, but the two ER Medium Lasers, Ferro-Fibrous Armor, and twin Partial Wings were built by the Clans. The partial wings increase the Wraith's jump range to 270 meters. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: Panther 9Rs are solid all-around 'Mechs, if a bit on the slow side. They make up for it with Jump Jets, considerable armor, and a hefty punch from their trademark PPC. They've even been used in physical slugging matches to good effect.

content.original: The JagerMech S model is highly specialized at long-range Autocannon fire support. It doesn't have much in the way of protection or closer-range weapons, though, so keep it distant and out of harm's way.

content.original: Thunderbolt SE models lose a little of their firepower in exchange for mounting Jump Jets. The greater mobility is intended to allow for more precision attacking maneuvers, though it all depends on the battlefield terrain.

content.original: The Stalker 3F mounts a ridiculous amount of weaponry—even for an assault 'Mech. It is also notable for its incredibly poor heat management, which is the cost it pays for such amazing damage output. Powerful, but to be used wisely.

content.original: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch.
content.prevOriginal: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch.

content.original: Enforcer 4R models combine the hefty power of an Autocannon and massive Laser with the mobility of Jump Jets—a deadly combination. Able to engage at medium-long all the way to point-blank range, these 'Mechs are flexible and surprising in combat.

content.original: Jenner Ds run hot, and they run fast but can quickly bound into combat to deliver a knockout punch, even against heavier units. Their capability with speed and weaponry tends to come at the expense of lower armor capacity, though.

content.original: The Orion K was the first true heavy 'Mech. As a multi-role brawler, the Orion can engage enemies at a variety of ranges, and with plenty of armor, it can survive combined fire for quite some time. Slow, yes—but powerful.

content.original: Ah, the Catapult C1. Just like its namesake, it's good at lobbing large numbers of missiles over terrain without fear of return fire. Surprisingly, it's also not too shabby at closer ranges in a pinch.

content.original: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A models are able to engage at any range, but their damage curve increases as they approach a target.

content.original: The Dragon 1N is a beefy machine that can take a serious beating but tends to be a bit light on weaponry. It moves fast for a heavy 'Mech, though, which makes it well suited to closing for Melee attacks against slower targets.

content.original: Griffin 1Ns use their Jump Jets to stay at range and pelt their opponents from relative safety. 1Ns can run hot if they spend all their time bounding around the battlefield taking potshots, though.

content.original: This Griffin was introduced to the Taurian Concordat. It carries a Plasma Cannon and three ER medium lasers. It also has a higher top speed than its inspiration and can jump farther as well.

content.original: The Soarece was an experimental superheavy combat vehicle produced for the Free Worlds League in the early decades of the Third Succession War. The design was commissioned by then-Captain-General Philippa Marik in 2881. It was envisioned as a low-cost, highly survivable design that could engage BattleMechs and equip the League's depleted defensive formations . It would be over two decades (2904) until the final form of this design was settled, by which time it had become a mammoth of a tank. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Limited Amphibious Values A S Front 770 126 Left 660 126 Right 660 126 Rear 350 126 Turret 760 126 Total 3200 630 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics

content.original: Debuted in 3144 on the Tennessee Valley Arena and piloted by Marie Costa, the most striking piece of technology this machine features is a Void Signature System followed by the Clan-spec Ferro-Fibrous Armor that replaced its original Capellan-style Starshield Stealth Armor and its eleven Double Heat Sinks. In the weapons section, a single MML-9 launcher appears where once there were twin MML-3s, while the mech losses the Light PPCs in favor of more ER Medium Lasers (now three). Missing is Beagle active probe while an Improved Narc Missile Beacon Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

content.original: This variant is apparently an attempt by the Jade Falcons to use experimental technology in a combat unit. Originally mistaken for a LAM, the Cougar-XR uses a Partial Wing to extend its jump range to 210 meters. An LRM-15 launcher equipped with Artemis V FCS is located in each side torso, while an ER Medium Pulse Laser provides direct fire. It appears that the Cougar-XR is a standard BattleMech instead of being an OmniMech like its progenitor design. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: A uniquely hybridized brawler built from the husk of a CRB-20. Bogdan ''The Steel Beast'' Tubbs had the Big Steel Claw's chassis rebuilt to support the mounting of ballistic weaponry, presumably in the interest of creating a louder and more violent spectacle in the arena. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

content.original: The Gundam is a testament to cutting-edge technology and raw power. With advanced weapons and mobility systems, this machine is built for domination on the battlefield. Its heavily armored exterior provides unrivaled protection from enemy attacks, making it a formidable opponent for any force that stands in its way. The Gundam is a technological marvel, and the pilots who use it should be ready for a high-powered and efficient machine. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
This custom Solaris variant debuted in 3128 in Noisiel and piloted first by Natalia Porter and then by her daughter Carolyn Fischer, this Clint IIC upgrade reverses the trend of Clan-modified-Inner-Sphere machines. Starting from the Clan-built frame, the variant drops the Jump Jets to change the weapon load. It keeps the two Clan Extended Range Medium Laser and swaps the Clan LB 10-X AC for a Large Variable Speed Pulse Laser and a Medium Re-Engineered Laser mating them all to a Clan Targeting Computer. The standard plate armor is replaced with Ballistic-Reinforced Armor. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

In 2775 as Aleksander Kerensky's forces were tightening the noose around the Amaris Empire, weapons development became increasingly frantic in hopes of finding a miracle weapon to turn the tides of the war. The most well known of these is the Matar, commonly referred to as Amaris' Folly, an attempt to create a BattleMech able to withstand an entire company. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: Debuted in 3141 on the Tennessee Valley Arena and piloted by Ira Kuhn-Bedard, the variant keeps the best features of this hundred-year-old machine and make it even better. With Clan Ferro-Lamellor Armor improving its resistance to nearly all forms of damage and combined with a Clan-spec XL Engine model instead of the original Inner Sphere one to improve endurance. MASC boosting its land speed, and four Clan ER Medium Lasers replacing all the original weaponry. A Hatchet has been fitted to make it more Solaris Games enabled. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: Developed under the guidance of Angelique Claw for Zellbrigen Stables, the Wraith Alexander combines Experimental Technology from the Clans and Inner Sphere to create a unique 'Mech. The use of a Clan-made XL Engine keeps the speed high, and allows for the installation of more equipment. The jump jets, Endo Steel structure, and Snub-Nose PPC are of Inner Sphere manufacture, but the two ER Medium Lasers, Ferro-Fibrous Armor, and twin Partial Wings were built by the Clans. The partial wings increase the Wraith's jump range to 270 meters. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The Assassin II is the result of a Federated Suns specification calling for a 'quick strike harasser unit'. The Maltex Corporation proposed a major redesign of their older Assassin chassis, the resulting BattleMech exceeded all expectations and has started to see use as a counter to the stealth technology employed by the Capellan Confederation. Quirk: Integrated TSM Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
In an attempt to marry OmniTechnology to a Advanced Stealthed Land Air Mech have Shengli Arm's created the 'Berkut' based on recovered Shadowhawk LAM designs. Only being able to mount a limited amount of Slots was the Design still considered a success. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Only being able to mount a limited amount of Slots was the Design still considered a success. Особенность: Мех «земля-воздух» Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.04

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Based on recovered Clan Crossbows and ancient SLDF experimental notes, RISC and Skobel Engineers managed to create a more modern Crossbow. Employing an experimental Extra-Light Gyro and Light Engine on an Endo-Steel chassis, they managed to upgrade both its mobility and firepower. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Constantly being upgraded with the latest technologies first by Comstar, then Word of Blake and lastly by Republic Engineers.

content.content: Stealth OmniMech

content.original: The first BattleMech to utilize the advanced Void Signature System, while reports of 'invisible 'Mechs' had long been ignored as confusion for such Star League era stealth systems as the Null Signature System and Chameleon Light Polarization Shield, allowed the 'Stealth Raptor' to be used with deadly effect.

content.original:
The Assassin II is the result of a Federated Suns specification calling for a 'quick strike harasser unit'. The Maltex Corporation proposed a major redesign of their older Assassin chassis, the resulting BattleMech exceeded all expectations and has started to see use as a counter to the stealth technology employed by the Capellan Confederation. Quirk: Integrated TSM Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Лимит приводов рук: Omni

content.original:
The Mhacha is another genious design from the Morrigan program, named for a protective goddess was this Chassis designed to provide Long Range Firepower and AA Protection. Quirk: Morrigan C3i Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni
